name: Window

properties.name: graphics
properties.description: The graphics object that can be used to customize the window’s appearance, in response to the

properties.name: visible
properties.description: When true, the element is shown, when false it is hidden.

properties.name: bounds
properties.description: The bounds of the window's drawable area, excluding the frame, in screen coordinates.

properties.name: frameBounds
properties.description: The bounds of the window frame in screen coordinates.

properties.name: frameLocation
properties.description: The top left corner of the window frame in screen coordinates.

properties.name: frameSize
properties.description: The size and location of the window's frame in screen coordinates.

properties.name: location
properties.description: The upper left corner of the window's drawable area.

properties.name: maximumSize
properties.description: The largest rectangle to which the window can be resized.

properties.name: minimumSize
properties.description: The smallest rectangle to which the window can be resized.

properties.name: preferredSize
properties.description: The preferred size of the window.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The current size and location of the content area of the window in screen coordinates.

properties.name: windowBounds
properties.description: The bounds of this window relative to the top-level parent window.

properties.name: characters
properties.description: A number of characters for which to reserve space when calculating the preferred size of the window.
The default text justification style for child text elements.
properties.name: justify
text
properties.description: The title, label, or displayed text, a localizeable string.

properties.name: active
properties.description: Set to true to make this window active.

properties.name: shortcutKey
properties.description: The keypress combination that invokes this element's

properties.name: cancelElement
properties.description: For windows of type

properties.name: defaultElement
properties.description: For windows of type

properties.name: maximized
properties.description: True if the window is expanded.

properties.name: minimized
properties.description: True if the window is minimized or iconified.

properties.name: alignChildren
properties.description: Tells the layout manager how unlike-sized children of this container should be aligned within a column or row.

properties.name: children
properties.description: The collection of UI elements that have been added to this container.

properties.name: layout
properties.description: The layout manager for this container.

properties.name: margins
properties.description: The number of pixels between the edges of a container and the outermost child elements.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: The layout orientation of children in a container.

properties.name: spacing
properties.description: The number of pixels separating one child element from its adjacent sibling element.

properties.name: alignment
properties.description: The alignment style for child elements of a container. If defined, this value overrides the

properties.name: properties
properties.description: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the container (properties used only when the element is created).

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: True if this element is enabled.

properties.name: helpTip
properties.description: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

properties.name: indent
properties.description: The number of pixels to indent the element.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: The immediate parent element.

properties.name: window
properties.description: The window that this element belongs to.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The element type; "dialog", "palette", or "window".
The opacity of the window, in the range [0..1].
properties.name: opacity

methods.name: notify
methods.description: Sends a notification message to all listeners, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: The event name; if omitted, the default event is sent.

methods.name: center
methods.description: Centers this window on screen or with repect to another window.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: The relative window. If not specified, centers on the screen.

parameters.name: return
parameters.description: A number to be returned from the show() method that invoked this window as a modal dialog.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Creates and returns a new control or container object and adds it to the children of this window.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the child element, as specified for the

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: A bounds specification that describes the size and position of the new control or container, relative to its parent.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text or label, a localizable string.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the new child (properties used only when the element is created).

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes the specified child control from this window’s

parameters.name: what
parameters.description: The child control to remove, specified by 0-based index,

methods.name: addEventListener
methods.description: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this window.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: The function that handles the event.
When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameters.name: capturePhase

methods.name: removeEventListener
methods.description: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this window.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: The function that handles the event.
Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameters.name: capturePhase

methods.name: dispatchEvent
methods.description: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.

properties.name: frameworkName
properties.description: Deprecated. Use

properties.name: version
properties.description: Deprecated. Use

description: The instance represents a top-level window or dialog box, which contains user-interface elements.
